newsitem.title: INDIA: India I-Sec sees lower yield at bond auction.
newsitem.headline: India I-Sec sees lower yield at bond auction.

text.p: Indian securities firm ICICI Securities & Finance Company (I-Sec) said on Wednesday it expected a cut-off yield of 13.60-13.65 percent at an auction of 10-year government bonds scheduled for Thursday.
"The auction on 20 February should see the cut-off yield in the region of 13.60 to 13.65 percent, the possibility of devolvement being remote," I-Sec said in a commentary.
"The new gilt issue completes the budgeted borrowing requirements of the government and is probably the first 10-year to be sold through an auction," it said.
The previous 10-year 20.0 billion rupee offer was at a fixed coupon of 13.85 percent and received 48 percent market subscription, I-Sec said.
"However, since then CRR (cash reserve ratio) has been reduced by 2.0 percent and yields have declined across maturities," it said.
"Issuance yields on three year and five year gilts have dropped by 30 and 20 basis points respectively and coupon on the 10-year state loan has dropped to 13.75 percent," it said.
